frameDefinitions: An Entity exists at a particular Location, at a particular Time, as observed by an implicit observer.
A Host is judged regarding their attitude as a potential host in a guest-host relationship.
An Agent performs a Response action in consequence of a Trigger event.
A Protagonist is sensitive to a Trigger, which has the potential to cause some kind of reaction in the Protagonist.  '' 'Mr. Clinton and his wife Hillary are allergic to cats.'
An Agent matches location with an Entity in order to fulfill some  Purpose.
These words describe how outgoing or sociable a Protagonist is judged to be by a (usually implicit)
frameExamples: Liquid water was <t>present</t> on the surface of Mars billions of years ago.
I found the board to be very <t>hospitable</t> to Russian graduates.
I <t>respond</t> to earthquakes by hiding under my desk.
Mr. Clinton and his wife Hillary are <t>allergic</t> to cats.
I ca n't remember how many times he <t>visited</t> ! DNI
He was <t>shy</t> with strangers and afraid of showing his feelings.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Entity</fen> whose existence at the <fen>Location</fen> is confirmed.
The <fen>Location</fen> of the <fen>Entity</fen>. The <fen>Location</fen> is conceived as a ground for an event of inspection to determine the presense of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Entity</fen> is present at the <fen>Location</fen>.
The <fen>Host</fen> is the person whose <fen>Behavior</fen> towards others as a (potential) host is evaluated.
The <fen>Guest</fen> is the entity which is positively or negatively treated by the <fen>Host</fen>.
The <fen>Behavior</fen> is the action of the <fen>Host</fen> on which the evaluation of the <fen>Host</fen>'s character is based.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the situation or person that the <fen>Host</fen>'s <fen>Behavior</fen> responds to or is related to.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which indicates the character of the <fen>Host</fen>.
The individual whose point of view is taken in assigning the evaluation.
The means action whereby the <fen>Agent</fen> responds to the Trigger.
A non-agentive entity that is impinged upon by a <fen>Trigger</fen> event to which they respond.
An event that impinges upon the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Responding_entity</fen> and produces a <fen>Response</fen> from it.
The intentional <fen>Agent</fen> that is impinged upon by a <fen>Trigger</fen> event to which they respond.
The point in time when the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Responding_entity</fen> manifests its <fen>Response</fen> to the <fen>Trigger</fen> .
The location in which the <fen>Response</fen> action takes place.
The <fen>Protagonist</fen> occurs as the External Argument of the targets in this frame. The <fen>Protagonist</fen> represents the one exhibiting the response to the <fen>Trigger</fen>.

The <fen>Trigger</fen> most commonly occurs in a PP Complement headed by <ment>to</ment>. The <fen>Trigger</fen> is that substance or element which causes a health response in the <fen>Protagonist</fen>.
The sentient entity that is temporarily with the <fen>Entity</fen> in order to fulfil some <fen>Purpose</fen>.

The physical entity that is permanently associated with entities or characteristics that the <fen>Agent</fen> wishes to use for some <fen>Purpose</fen>.  During the visit, the <fen>Agent</fen> matches location with the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The time at which a visit is made.
A description of the position of the <fen>Agent</fen> during the visit.
The Protagonist is the person whose sociability is being described.
The Protagonist may be sociable, shy, outgoing, etc. when with particular Company (specific people or types of people).  Company usually occurs in a PP Complement with a target adjective:
The Protagonist may be sociable, shy, outgoing, etc. when in a particular situation, or about performing some action.
listRoleExamples: The diocese responded <fex>by taking the property</fex>
How has the modern welfare state responded <fex>to the needs of working class women</fex>, and why?
Once again <fex>the Government</fex> is responding to a crisis with measures that will only harm patients
Israel responded <fex>yesterday</fex> to the killing of 22 people by Palestinian suicide bombers with a helicopter attack

The auto industry has responded <fex>in the U.S., but particularly in Asian and European markets</fex> by manufacturing an entry-level segment of cars that is more appealing, better looking, and safer than in the past.
<fex>Pat's</fex> allergy to dairy products is severe.
Some people are very sensitive <fex>to chemicals in the environment</fex>.
